<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
 <meta charset="UTF-8">
 <title>Spooky Ed - About</title>
 <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
 <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Creepster&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
 <style>
 .background-image {
 position: fixed;
 top: 0;
 left: 0;
 width: 100%;
 height: 100%;
 object-fit: cover;
 z-index: -2;
 }

 body {
 margin: 0;
 padding: 0;
 font-family: 'Comic Sans MS', cursive, sans-serif;
 background-color: #1a0030;
 min-height: 100vh;
 color: #fff;
 position: relative;
 }

 body::before {
 content: '';
 position: fixed;
 top: 0;
 left: 0;
 width: 100%;
 height: 100%;
 background: linear-gradient(135deg, rgba(45, 0, 69, 0.6) 0%, rgba(90, 0, 128, 0.6) 50%, rgba(26, 0, 48, 0.6) 100%);
 pointer-events: none;
 z-index: -1;
 }

 header, main {
 position: relative;
 z-index: 1;
 }

 header nav {
 display: flex;
 justify-content: space-between;
 align-items: center;
 background: rgba(35, 0, 62, 0.85);
 padding: 20px 60px;
 }

 nav ul {
 list-style: none;
 display: flex;
 gap: 35px;
 margin: 0;
 padding: 0;
 }

 nav ul li a {
 color: #fff;
 text-decoration: none;
 font-weight: bold;
 padding-bottom: 4px;
 }

 nav ul li a.active {
 color: #ffd600;
 border-bottom: 2px solid #ffd600;
 }

 .top-center-text {
 position: fixed;
 top: 20px;
 left: 50%;
 transform: translateX(-50%);
 font-family: 'Creepster', cursive, 'Comic Sans MS', cursive, sans-serif;
 font-size: 60px;
 color: #00ffd5;
 text-shadow: 2px 2px 5px #000000a8;
 z-index: 1000;
 user-select: none;
 }

 main .container {
 display: flex;
 min-height: 80vh;
 align-items: center;
 justify-content: center;
 padding: 50px 20px;
 gap: 40px;
 }

 .login-content {
 background: rgba(0, 251, 255, 0.5);
 padding: 38px 48px;
 border-radius: 18px;
 box-shadow: 0 0 20px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.18);
 width: 100%;
 max-width: 1000px;
 position: relative;
 }

 .decorative-cat {
 position: absolute;
 width: 80px;
 top: 2px;
 left: 21px;
 opacity: 0.8;
 }

import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.*

import com.runanywhere.startup_hackathon20.ui.theme.Startup_hackathon20Theme

class SpookyEdActivity : ComponentActivity() {
 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 enableEdgeToEdge()
 setContent {
 Startup_hackathon20Theme {
 SpookyEdScreen()
 }
 }
 }

@SuppressLint("SetJavaScriptEnabled")
@Composable
fun SpookyEdScreen() {
 var canGoBack by remember { mutableStateOf(false) }
 var webView: WebView? by remember { mutableStateOf(null) }

 Scaffold { padding ->
 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .padding(padding)
 ) {
 AndroidView(
 factory = { context ->
 WebView(context).apply {
 webViewClient = object : WebViewClient() {
 override fun onPageFinished(view: WebView?, url: String?) {
 super.onPageFinished(view, url)
 canGoBack = view?.canGoBack() ?: false
 Log.d("SpookyEdWebView", "Page finished loading: $url")
 }

 override fun shouldOverrideUrlLoading(
 view: WebView?,
 url: String?
 ): Boolean {
 Log.d("SpookyEdWebView", "Navigation to: $url")
 return false
 }
 }

 webChromeClient = object : WebChromeClient() {
 override fun onConsoleMessage(consoleMessage: ConsoleMessage?): Boolean {
 consoleMessage?.let {
 Log.d(
 "SpookyEdWebView",
 "${it.message()} -- From line ${it.lineNumber()} of ${it.sourceId()}"
 )
 }
 return true
 }
 }

 settings.apply {
 javaScriptEnabled = true
 domStorageEnabled = true
 databaseEnabled = true
 allowFileAccess = true
 allowContentAccess = true
 mixedContentMode = android.webkit.WebSettings.MIXED_CONTENT_ALWAYS_ALLOW
 // Enable remote debugging
 WebView.setWebContentsDebuggingEnabled(true)
 }

 // Load with loadDataWithBaseURL to ensure proper base URL
 try {
 val htmlContent = context.assets.open("home.html").bufferedReader()
 .use { it.readText() }
 loadDataWithBaseURL(
 "file:///android_asset/",
 htmlContent,
 "text/html",
 "UTF-8",
 null
 )
 Log.d("SpookyEdWebView", "Initial home.html loaded successfully")
 } catch (e: Exception) {
 Log.e("SpookyEdWebView", "Error loading home.html", e)
 e.printStackTrace()
 }

 webView = this
 }
 },
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize()
 )
 }
 }

 androidx.activity.compose.BackHandler(enabled = canGoBack) {
 webView?.goBack()
 }
}

+// JavaScript interface to launch external apps
+class GameLauncher(private val context: Context) {
+ @JavascriptInterface
+ fun launchGame(packageName: String) {
+ try {
+ Log.d("GameLauncher", "Attempting to launch app: $packageName")
+ val intent = context.packageManager.getLaunchIntentForPackage(packageName)
+ if (intent != null) {
+ intent.addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK)
+ context.startActivity(intent)
+ Log.d("GameLauncher", "Successfully launched app: $packageName")
+ } else {
+ Log.e("GameLauncher", "App not installed: $packageName")
+ // Show toast on main thread
+ (context as? ComponentActivity)?.runOnUiThread {
+ Toast.makeText(
+ context,
+ "Game not installed. Please install the game first.",
+ Toast.LENGTH_LONG
+ ).show()
+ }
+ // Open Play Store
+ openPlayStore(packageName)
+ }
+ } catch (e: Exception) {
+ Log.e("GameLauncher", "Error launching app: $packageName", e)
+ (context as? ComponentActivity)?.runOnUiThread {
+ Toast.makeText(
+ context,
+ "Error launching game: ${e.message}",
+ Toast.LENGTH_SHORT
+ ).show()
+ }
+ }
+ }
+
+ @JavascriptInterface
+ fun openPlayStore(packageName: String) {
+ try {
+ val intent = Intent(Intent.ACTION_VIEW, Uri.parse("market://details?id=$packageName"))
+ intent.addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK)
+ context.startActivity(intent)
+ } catch (e: ActivityNotFoundException) {
+ // If Play Store app is not available, open in browser
+ val intent = Intent(
+ Intent.ACTION_VIEW,
+ Uri.parse("https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=$packageName")
+ )
+ intent.addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK)
+ context.startActivity(intent)
+ }
+ }
+}

+# Game Launcher Setup Guide
 
+## Overview
+
+Your Spooky Ed app can now launch external APK files (other installed apps) when clicking on game
+icons!
+
+## How It Works
+
+### 1. **JavaScript Interface** (`GameLauncher`)
+
+- Provides a bridge between the WebView (HTML/JS) and Android native code
+- Two main functions:
+ - `launchGame(packageName)` - Launches an installed app
+ - `openPlayStore(packageName)` - Opens Play Store if app is not installed
+
+### 2. **What Happens When User Clicks a Game Icon:**
+
+1. JavaScript calls `GameLauncher.launchGame("com.package.name")`
+2. Android checks if the app is installed
+3. If **installed**: Launches the game ✅
+4. If **NOT installed**: Shows a toast message and opens Play Store 
+
+## Setup Instructions
+
+### Step 1: Get the Package Names of Your Games
+
+You need to know the **package name** of each game APK you want to launch.
+
+**How to find a package name:**
+
+- If you built the game: Check the `applicationId` in the game's `build.gradle` file
+- If it's an existing app: Use a package name viewer app or check the Play Store URL
+ - Example: `https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.example.game`
+ - Package name is: `com.example.game`
+
+### Step 2: Update the Package Names in menu.html
+
+Open `app/src/main/assets/menu.html` and find this section (around line 239):
+
+```javascript
+const packageNames = {
+ 1: 'com.example.trickoranswer', // Replace with actual package name for Game 1
+ 2: 'com.example.potionbrewing' // Replace with actual package name for Game 2
+};
+```
+
+**Replace with your actual game package names:**
+
+```javascript
+const packageNames = {
+ 1: 'com.yourdomain.trickoranswer', // Your actual Game 1 package
+ 2: 'com.yourdomain.potionbrewing' // Your actual Game 2 package
+};
+```
+
+### Step 3: Test It!
+
+1. **Install both games** on your test device
+2. Run the Spooky Ed app
+3. Click on a game icon
+4. The game should launch! 
+
+## User Experience
+
+### If Game IS Installed:
+
+- Game launches immediately
+- User can play and return to Spooky Ed using the back button
+
+### If Game is NOT Installed:
+
+- Toast message appears: "Game not installed. Please install the game first."
+- Play Store opens automatically to the game's page
+- User can install and then try again
+
+## Example Package Names
+
+Here are some example formats:
+
+```javascript
+const packageNames = {
+ 1: 'com.spookyed.trickoranswer',
+ 2: 'com.spookyed.potionbrewing'
+};
+```
+
+## Troubleshooting
+
+### Game doesn't launch?
+
+1. Check the package name is correct (case-sensitive!)
+2. Ensure the game is installed on the device
+3. Check Android logs: `adb logcat | grep GameLauncher`
+
+### Need to launch by APK file path instead?
+
+The current implementation launches **installed apps by package name**. To install and launch from
+an APK file path would require:
+
+- Storage permissions
+- Package installer permissions
+- Different implementation (let me know if you need this!)
+
+## Advanced: Adding More Games
+
+To add a third game:
+
+1. Add another game icon in `menu.html`:
+
+```html
+<div id="game3" class="game-icon" onclick="launchGame(3)">
+ <img src="images/game icon 3.jpg" alt="New Game">
+</div>
+```
+
+2. Add its package name:
+
+```javascript
+const packageNames = {
+ 1: 'com.example.trickoranswer',
+ 2: 'com.example.potionbrewing',
+ 3: 'com.example.newgame' // Add new game here
+};
+```
+
+3. Style and position it in CSS!
+
+## Notes
+
+- Package names are unique identifiers for Android apps
+- Games must be **installed** to launch
+- The system handles app switching automatically
+- Users can return to Spooky Ed using the back button
+
+---
+
+**Need help?** Check the logs with `adb logcat | grep -E "GameLauncher|SpookyEdWebView"`
+
```

+package com.runanywhere.startup_hackathon20
 
+import android.os.Bundle
+import androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
+import androidx.activity.compose.setContent
+import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
+import androidx.compose.foundation.background
+import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.*
+import androidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
+import androidx.compose.material.icons.automirrored.filled.ArrowBack
+import androidx.compose.material3.*
+import androidx.compose.runtime.*
+import androidx.compose.ui.Alignment
+import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
+import androidx.compose.ui.graphics.Brush
+import androidx.compose.ui.graphics.Color
+import androidx.compose.ui.text.font.FontFamily
+import androidx.compose.ui.text.font.FontWeight
+import androidx.compose.ui.text.style.TextAlign
+import androidx.compose.ui.unit.dp
+import androidx.compose.ui.unit.sp
+import com.runanywhere.startup_hackathon20.ui.theme.Startup_hackathon20Theme
+
+class TrickOrAnswerActivity : ComponentActivity() {
+ override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+ super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
+ enableEdgeToEdge()
+ setContent {
+ Startup_hackathon20Theme {
+ TrickOrAnswerScreen(onBackPressed = { finish() })
+ }
+ }
+ }
+}
+
+@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
+@Composable
+fun TrickOrAnswerScreen(onBackPressed: () -> Unit) {
+ val spookyPurple = Color(0xFF5a0080)
+ val darkPurple = Color(0xFF1a0030)
+ val spookyGreen = Color(0xFF00ffd5)
+
+ Scaffold(
+ topBar = {
+ TopAppBar(
+ title = {
+ Text(
+ "Trick or Answer",
+ fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold,
+ color = spookyGreen
+ )
+ },
+ navigationIcon = {
+ IconButton(onClick = onBackPressed) {
+ Icon(
+ Icons.AutoMirrored.Filled.ArrowBack,
+ contentDescription = "Back",
+ tint = spookyGreen
+ )
+ }
+ },
+ colors = TopAppBarDefaults.topAppBarColors(
+ containerColor = Color(0xFF23003e)
+ )
+ )
+ }
+ ) { padding ->
+ Box(
+ modifier = Modifier
+ .fillMaxSize()
+ .padding(padding)
+ .background(
+ Brush.linearGradient(
+ colors = listOf(darkPurple, spookyPurple, darkPurple)
+ )
+ ),
+ contentAlignment = Alignment.Center
+ ) {
+ Column(
+ horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,
+ verticalArrangement = Arrangement.Center,
+ modifier = Modifier.padding(32.dp)
+ ) {
+ Text(
+ text = "",
+ fontSize = 80.sp,
+ modifier = Modifier.padding(bottom = 24.dp)
+ )
+
+ Text(
+ text = "Trick or Answer",
+ fontSize = 36.sp,
+ fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold,
+ color = spookyGreen,
+ textAlign = TextAlign.Center,
+ fontFamily = FontFamily.Cursive
+ )
+
+ Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(16.dp))
+
+ Text(
+ text = "Get ready for spooky questions and Halloween fun!",
+ fontSize = 18.sp,
+ color = Color.White,
+ textAlign = TextAlign.Center,
+ modifier = Modifier.padding(horizontal = 32.dp)
+ )
+
+ Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(32.dp))
+
+ Card(
+ modifier = Modifier
+ .fillMaxWidth()
+ .padding(horizontal = 16.dp),
+ colors = CardDefaults.cardColors(
+ containerColor = Color(0xFF40e9ec).copy(alpha = 0.3f)
+ )
+ ) {
+ Column(
+ modifier = Modifier.padding(24.dp),
+ horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally
+ ) {
+ Text(
+ text = "Game Coming Soon!",
+ fontSize = 24.sp,
+ fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold,
+ color = Color(0xFFffd600)
+ )
+
+ Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(16.dp))
+
+ Text(
+ text = "This is a placeholder for the Trick or Answer game. You can replace this screen with your actual game implementation.",
+ fontSize = 16.sp,
+ color = Color.White,
+ textAlign = TextAlign.Center
+ )
+
+ Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(24.dp))
+
+ Button(
+ onClick = onBackPressed,
+ colors = ButtonDefaults.buttonColors(
+ containerColor = Color(0xFFffd600),
+ contentColor = Color(0xFF3a1550)
+ )
+ ) {
+ Text(
+ "Back to Menu",
+ fontSize = 18.sp,
+ fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold
+ )
+ }
+ }
+ }
+ }
+ }
+ }
+}
+

## ** About the Errors:**

The linter errors you're seeing are **temporary** and happen because:

1. **New files just created**: `TrickOrAnswerActivity.kt` and `PotionBrewingActivity.kt` are brand new
2. **Android Studio needs to index**: The IDE hasn't fully recognized these new classes yet
3. **Gradle needs to sync**: The build system needs to be updated

## **✅ How to Fix the Errors:**

### **Step 1: Sync Gradle** (Most Important!)
Click on **"Sync Now"** at the top of Android Studio, or:
- Go to **File → Sync Project with Gradle Files**
- Wait for it to complete

### **Step 2: Rebuild Project**
After syncing:
- Go to **Build → Clean Project**
- Then **Build → Rebuild Project**

### **Step 3: The errors should disappear!** 

---

## ** What I've Built For You:**

### **1. Two Game Activities** ✅
- `TrickOrAnswerActivity.kt` - Trick or Answer game ()
- `PotionBrewingActivity.kt` - Potion Brewing game ()

### **2. Both are:**
- ✅ **In landscape mode** (locked)
- ✅ **Themed with spooky colors** (purple gradient, glowing text)
- ✅ **Have back buttons** to return to menu
- ✅ **Placeholder screens** saying "Game Coming Soon!"

### **3. Updated Files:**
- ✅ `AndroidManifest.xml` - Registered both activities
- ✅ `SpookyEdActivity.kt` - Added GameLauncher to open activities
- ✅ `menu.html` - Updated to launch internal activities

### **4. How It Works:**
```
Click Game Icon → JavaScript calls GameLauncher.launchGame(1 or 2) 
→ Android opens TrickOrAnswerActivity or PotionBrewingActivity
→ User plays game → Presses back → Returns to menu
```

---

## ** Next Steps After Sync:**

1. **Run the app**
2. **Click on a game icon**
3. **You should see** the placeholder game screen open!
4. **Click "Back to Menu"** or device back button to return

## ** Customizing the Games:**

To add your actual game content, edit these files:
- `TrickOrAnswerActivity.kt` - Replace the placeholder UI
- `PotionBrewingActivity.kt` - Replace the placeholder UI

The games are **fully contained within your app** - no external APKs needed! ✨

import android.annotation.SuppressLint
import android.content.Context
import android.content.Intent
import android.os.Bundle
import android.util.Log
import android.webkit.ConsoleMessage
import android.webkit.JavascriptInterface
import android.webkit.WebChromeClient
import android.webkit.WebView
import android.webkit.WebViewClient
import android.widget.Toast
import androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
import androidx.activity.compose.setContent
import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.*
import androidx.compose.material3.*
import androidx.compose.runtime.*
import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
import androidx.compose.ui.viewinterop.AndroidView
import com.runanywhere.startup_hackathon20.ui.theme.Startup_hackathon20Theme
import kotlin.jvm.java

class SpookyEdActivity : ComponentActivity() {
 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 enableEdgeToEdge()
 setContent {
 Startup_hackathon20Theme {
 SpookyEdScreen(this)
 }
 }
 }
}

// JavaScript interface to launch internal game activities
class GameLauncher(private val context: Context) {
 @JavascriptInterface
 fun launchGame(gameNumber: Int) {
 try {
 Log.d("GameLauncher", "Attempting to launch game: $gameNumber")

 val intent = when (gameNumber) {
 1 -> Intent(context, TrickOrAnswerActivity::class.java)
 2 -> Intent(context, PotionBrewingActivity::class.java)
 else -> {
 Log.e("GameLauncher", "Invalid game number: $gameNumber")
 return
 }
 }

 intent.addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK)
 context.startActivity(intent)
 Log.d("GameLauncher", "Successfully launched game: $gameNumber")
 } catch (e: Exception) {
 Log.e("GameLauncher", "Error launching game: $gameNumber", e)
 (context as? ComponentActivity)?.runOnUiThread {
 Toast.makeText(
 context,
 "Error launching game: ${e.message}",
 Toast.LENGTH_SHORT
 ).show()
 }
 }
 }
}

@SuppressLint("SetJavaScriptEnabled")
@Composable
fun SpookyEdScreen(activity: ComponentActivity) {
 var canGoBack by remember { mutableStateOf(false) }
 var webView: WebView? by remember { mutableStateOf(null) }

 Scaffold { padding ->
 Box(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .padding(padding)
 ) {
 AndroidView(
 factory = { context ->
 WebView(context).apply {
 webViewClient = object : WebViewClient() {
 override fun onPageFinished(view: WebView?, url: String?) {
 super.onPageFinished(view, url)
 canGoBack = view?.canGoBack() ?: false
 Log.d("SpookyEdWebView", "Page finished loading: $url")
 }

 override fun shouldOverrideUrlLoading(
 view: WebView?,
 url: String?
 ): Boolean {
 Log.d("SpookyEdWebView", "Navigation to: $url")
 return false
 }
 }

 webChromeClient = object : WebChromeClient() {
 override fun onConsoleMessage(consoleMessage: ConsoleMessage?): Boolean {
 consoleMessage?.let {
 Log.d(
 "SpookyEdWebView",
 "${it.message()} -- From line ${it.lineNumber()} of ${it.sourceId()}"
 )
 }
 return true
 }
 }

 settings.apply {
 javaScriptEnabled = true
 domStorageEnabled = true
 databaseEnabled = true
 allowFileAccess = true
 allowContentAccess = true
 mixedContentMode = android.webkit.WebSettings.MIXED_CONTENT_ALWAYS_ALLOW
 // Enable remote debugging
 WebView.setWebContentsDebuggingEnabled(true)
 }

 // Load with loadDataWithBaseURL to ensure proper base URL
 try {
 val htmlContent = context.assets.open("home.html").bufferedReader()
 .use { it.readText() }
 loadDataWithBaseURL(
 "file:///android_asset/",
 htmlContent,
 "text/html",
 "UTF-8",
 null
 )
 Log.d("SpookyEdWebView", "Initial home.html loaded successfully")
 } catch (e: Exception) {
 Log.e("SpookyEdWebView", "Error loading home.html", e)
 e.printStackTrace()
 }

 addJavascriptInterface(GameLauncher(context), "GameLauncher")
 webView = this
 }
 },
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize()
 )
 }
 }

 androidx.activity.compose.BackHandler(enabled = canGoBack) {
 webView?.goBack()
 }
